subtitle: How will we cope with two?
description: How will we cope with two?
title: TIREDMama: Money is tight
content:
Brought to you MAMA Two months ago, I left my job to look for work that I can
do from home. I do need to work to bring in extra money – but I’m pregnant
with my second child. We didn’t plan to have another baby right now. We can
barely afford one child, but soon we will have two. My husband has been taking
on extra shifts to help. It’s tough because now he is hardly ever at home and
we don’t see much of each other. For the past two months I’ve been waking up
at 5am to do some housework before my little one wakes. Then I get her ready
for school. After I have taken her to school, I walk around the neighbourhood
looking for work. I ask if there are any cleaning jobs I could do. I fetch my
daughter from school at 2pm, and then I have to keep her entertained, start
making supper and the cleaning routine starts again. Because I am so far into
my pregnancy, I am heavy and tired all the time. I want to sit down and put my
feet up. But there is no time for that. I have to do odd jobs and try to make
what money I can. Now, I am wondering what it's going to be like when I have
two. A toddler and a newborn. I have no time for my husband. I’m pregnant and
exhausted. So how will I find time for my new baby or myself? Somehow I know
that I must cope. Many women have done it before me. But sometimes it feels
impossible. **MAMA HELP: Are you expecting your 2nd or 3rd child? You will
need help. Reach out to trusted older family members and friends who have
children. If you are tired and alone, you may not be able to give your best to
your children. Ask for help and share child-minding duties with others.**
